actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d10) thunder damage.

actions.name: Thunderbolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage, and the target is knocked prone.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

actions.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: A kraken speaks through the priest with a thunderous voice audible within 300 feet. Creatures of the priest's choice that can hear the kraken's words (which are spoken in Abyssal, Infernal, or Primordial) must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the priest for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Laeral Silverhand
languages: Common, Draconic, Dwarvish, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Laeral wears a white robe of the archmagi (accounted for in her statistics). She wields a flame tongue longsword.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: While wearing her robe of the archmagi, Laeral has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Laeral is a 19th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). Laeral has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, minor illusion, , ray of frost
1st level (at will): detect magic, disguise self, magic missile, shield
2nd level (at will): detect thoughts, invisibility, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, sending, tongues
4th level (3 slots): banishment, greater invisibility, Otiluke's resilient sphere
5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, geas, Rary's telepathic bond
6th level (2 slots): globe of invulnerability, mass suggestion
7th level (1 slot): prismatic spray, teleport
8th level (1 slot): feeblemind, power word stun
9th level (1 slot): time stop

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Laeral makes three attacks with her silver hair and flame tongue, in any combination. She can cast one of her cantrips or 1st-level spells before or after making these attacks.

actions.name: Silver Hair
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) force damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Flame Tongue
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage when used with two hands.

actions.name: Spellfire (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.desc:
Magical, heatless, silver fire harmlessly erupts from Laeral and surrounds her until she is incapacitated or until she uses an action to quench it. She gains one of the following benefits of her choice, which lasts until the silver fire ends:
• She can breathe underwater.
• She can survive without food and water.
• She is immune to magic that would ascertain her thoughts, truthfulness, alignment, or creature type.
• She gains resistance to cold damage, and she is unharmed by temperatures as low as −50 degrees Fahrenheit.While the silver fire is present, she has the following additional action options:
• Cast the cure wounds spell. The target regains 1d8 + 5 hit points. After Laeral takes this action, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the silver fire disappears.
• Cast the revivify spell without material components. After Laeral takes this action, roll a d6. On a roll of 1–2, the silver fire disappears.
• Release a 60-foot line of silver fire that is 5 feet wide or a 30-foot cone of silver fire. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried take 26 (4d12) fire damage. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 26 (4d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After Laeral takes this action, roll a d6. On a roll of 1–3, the silver fire disappears.Laeral Silverhand, a powerful and ageless beauty with a penchant for arcane magic, is the fifth of seven daughters of the goddess Mystra. She held the title of Witch-Queen of the North and she married Khelben Arunsun, who would later become the Blackstaff, the Lord Mage of Waterdeep. She currently serves as Waterdeep's Open Lord.
Adventures (Dragon Heist)
			
				
			    	DnD 5e Monsters › Laeral Silverhand

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within 5 feet of the leucrotta must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The leucrotta makes one Bite attack and one Hooves attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Kicking Retreat
actions.desc: Immediately after the leucrotta makes a Hooves attack, it takes the Disengage action.

name: Leviathan
conditionImmunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

name: Lightning Hulk
conditionImmunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Skewer
traits.desc: Once per turn, when the lizardfolk makes a melee attack with its trident and hits, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage, and the lizardfolk gains temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lizardfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or trident or two melee attacks with its trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lizardfolk makes two melee attacks, each one with a different weapon.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spiked Shield
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Spellcasting (Lizardfolk Form Only)
traits.desc:
The lizardfolk is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The lizardfolk has the following druid spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, thorn whip
1st Level (4 slots): entangle, fog cloud
2nd Level (3 slots): heat metal, spike growth
3rd Level (2 slots): conjure animals (reptiles only), plant growth

actions.name: Multiattack (Lizardfolk Form Only)
actions.desc: The lizardfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage in crocodile form. If the lizardfolk is in crocodile form and the target is a Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizardfolk can't bite another target. If the lizardfolk reverts to its true form, the grapple ends.

actions.name: Claws (Lizardfolk Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The lizardfolk magically polymorphs into a crocodile, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.Monster Manual (BR+)
			
				
			    	DnD 5e Monsters › Lizardfolk Shaman

traits.name: Extraordinary Leap
traits.desc: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump 3 feet.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Sticky Leg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. Hit: The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape DC 12). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

name: Manshoon
saves: Str +2, Dex +4, Con +3, Int +13, Wis +9, Cha +5
languages: Common, Draconic, Goblin, Infernal, Orc, Undercommon

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The adept makes three Unarmed Strike attacks or five Dart attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. Once per turn, the adept can cause one of the following additional effects (choose one or roll a d4):

actions.name: 1–2
actions.desc: Knock Down-The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: 3–4
actions.desc: Push-The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet directly away from the adept.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Deflect Missile
actions.desc: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 3. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

name: Master Sage
skills: Arcana +11, History +11, Insight +7, Investigation +11, Medicine +10, Nature +11, Religion +11

name: Master Thief
skills: Acrobatics +7, Athletics +3, Perception +3, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +7
languages: any one language (usually Common) plus thieves' cant

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided the thief isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thief makes three Shortsword or Shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Cunning Action
actions.desc: The thief takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

actions.name: Uncanny Dodge
actions.desc: The thief halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The thief must be able to see the attacker.

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.desc: Any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within 10 feet of the meenlock must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the meenlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The meenlock teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it's teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination need not be within line of sight.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

name: Merregon
languages: understands Infernal but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the merregon's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The merregon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The merregon makes three Halberd attacks.

actions.name: Halberd
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Loyal Bodyguard
actions.desc: When another Fiend within 5 feet of the merregon is hit by an attack roll, the merregon causes itself to be hit instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The merrenoloth makes one Oar attack and uses Fear Gaze.

actions.name: Oar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Fear Gaze
actions.desc: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the merrenoloth for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The merrenoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The merrenoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

name: Metallic Greatwyrm
speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.
immunities: acid (copper), cold (silver), fire (brass and gold), or lightning (bronze)

name: Mighty Servant of Leuk-O
immunities: acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant
conditionImmunities: all conditions but invisible and prone
languages: understands the languages of creatures attuned to it but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Existence
traits.desc: The servant is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form or send it to another plane of existence.

traits.name: Magic Resistant Construction
traits.desc: The servant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks made against it have disadvantage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The servant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, this trait doesn't function until an attuned creature spends 24 hours repairing the artifact or until the artifact is subjected to lightning damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The servant's long jump is up to 50 feet and its high jump is up to 25 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The servant doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Destructive Fist
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage. If the target is an object, it takes triple damage.

actions.name: Crushing Leap
actions.desc: If the servant jumps at least 25 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures is pushed to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the servant and must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 26 (4d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

name: Miirym
conditionImmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.desc: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Molydeus
conditionImmunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Demonic Shadows
traits.desc: The nabassu darkens the area around its body in a 10-foot radius. Nonmagical light can't illuminate this area of dim light.

traits.name: Devour Soul
traits.desc: A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a Construct nor an Undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within 5 feet of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature's number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu's hit points by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The nabassu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nabassu makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it uses Soul-Stealing Gaze.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 38 (5d12 + 6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) force damage.

actions.name: Soul-Stealing Gaze
actions.desc: The nabassu targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or take 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the nabassu regains hit points equal to half that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, and if the target is a Humanoid, it immediately rises as a ghoul under the nabassu's control.

name: Nagpa
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nagpa makes three Staff or Deathly Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Deathly Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (7d6 + 6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The nagpa casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):

actions.name: Corruption
actions.desc: The nagpa targets one creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. An evil creature makes the save with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the nagpa until the start of the nagpa's next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to the nagpa's Corruption for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Paralysis (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The nagpa forces each creature within 30 feet of it to make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw, excluding Undead and Constructs. On a failed save, a target is paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Infernal Tack
traits.desc: The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion as an action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The narzugon makes three Hellfire Lance attacks. It also uses Infernal Command or Terrifying Command.

actions.name: Hellfire Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature with a soul, the soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

actions.name: Infernal Command
actions.desc: Each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Command
actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the narzugon that isn't a Fiend must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon's Terrifying Command for 24 hours.

actions.name: Healing (1/Day)
actions.desc: The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

actions.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
actions.desc: The necromancer magically summons five skeletons or zombies. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
actions.desc: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Neogi Master
languages: Common, Deep Speech, Undercommon, telepathy 30 ft.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, or it makes two Tentacle of Hadar attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle of Hadar
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the neogi's next turn, as a spectral tentacle clings to the target.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Nightwalker
conditionImmunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Annihilating Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

traits.name: Life Eater
traits.desc: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

actions.name: Enervating Focus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Nilbogism
traits.desc: Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.

actions.name: Fool's Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Mocking Word
actions.desc: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):

actions.name: Nimble Escape
actions.desc: The nilbog takes the Disengage or Hide action.

actions.name: Reversal of Fortune
actions.desc: In response to another creature dealing damage to the nilbog, the nilbog reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.

traits.name: Cloud of Vermin
traits.desc: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 20 feet of one or more nupperibos must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) acid damage. A creature within the areas of two or more nupperibos makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

traits.name: Driven Tracker
traits.desc: In the Nine Hells, the nupperibo can flawlessly track any creature that has taken damage from any nupperibo's Cloud of Vermin within the previous 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chain Smash (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Chain Sweep
actions.desc: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

actions.desc: Each creature of the war chief's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the war chief's next turn. The war chief can then make one attack as a bonus action.

name: Orcus
immunities: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Undeath
traits.desc: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Wand of Orcus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Conjure Undead (1/Day)
actions.desc: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures Undead creatures whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

actions.name: Wand Spellcasting
actions.desc: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save DC 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.desc: Orcus makes one Tail or Necrotic Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcus's next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

traits.desc: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless it is incapacitated or its speed is 0.

actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 38 (7d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the abishai's choice that is within 120 feet and aware of the abishai must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abishai's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Incite Fanaticism
actions.desc: The abishai chooses up to four other creatures within 60 feet of it that can see it. Until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with advantage and can't be frightened.

actions.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
actions.desc: The abishai targets one Dragon it can see within 120 feet of it. The Dragon must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. A chromatic dragon makes this save with disadvantage. On a successful save, the target is immune to the abishai's Power of the Dragon Queen for 1 hour. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. This effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.desc: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.desc: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Wicked Sickle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ironbound Pursuit
actions.desc: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

name: Retriever
immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
languages: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.desc: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses Force Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

actions.name: Foreleg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Force Beam
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

actions.name: Spellcasting

name: Rug of Smothering
conditionImmunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.desc: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

actions.name: Smother
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Contamination
traits.desc: The sibriex emits an aura of corruption 30 feet in every direction. Vegetation withers in the aura, and the ground in the aura is difficult terrain for other creatures. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this sibriex's Contamination for 24 hours.

actions.desc: The sibriex targets up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, a creature becomes immune to this sibriex's Warp Creature. On a failed save, the target is poisoned, which causes it to also gain 1 level of exhaustion. While poisoned in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it, and ending the poison removes any levels of exhaustion caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to gain another level of exhaustion. Once the target reaches 6 levels of exhaustion, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes under the sibriex's control. The transformation of the body can be undone only by a wish spell.

If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

immunities: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
conditionImmunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Discorporation
traits.desc: When Tiamat drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Nine Hells, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (3/Day)
traits.desc: Tiamat can innately cast divine word (spell save DC 26). Her spellcasting ability is Charisma.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If Tiamat fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: Unless she wishes to be affected, Tiamat is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Tiamat's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.desc: Tiamat can take one reaction per turn, rather than only one per round. She also has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious. If she fails a saving throw against an effect that would stun a creature, one of her unspent legendary actions is spent.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Tiamat regains 30 hit points at the start of her turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Tiamat can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes three attacks: two with her claws and one with her tail.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Weapon Attack: + 19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 19 to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of Tiamat's choice that is within 240 feet of Tiamat and aware of her must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Tiamat's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage (black dragon head), lightning damage (blue dragon head), poison damage (green dragon head), fire damage (red dragon head), or cold damage (white dragon head).

legendary.name: Black Dragon Head: Acid Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Tiamat exhales acid in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blue Dragon Head: Lightning Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Tiamat exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 (16d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Green Dragon Head: Poison Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Tiamat exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Constitution saving throw, taking 77 (22d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Red Dragon Head: Fire Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Tiamat exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: White Dragon Head: Cold Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc:
Tiamat exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 72 (16d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Tiamat is the dragon goddess of evil.

The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell; don't count that time. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, it dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete can end the curse. Doing so undoes the changes made to the target by the curse.

actions.desc: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The war priest makes two Maul attacks, and it uses Holy Fire.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage.

actions.name: Holy Fire
actions.desc: The war priest targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and it is blinded until the start of the war priest's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The war priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

actions.name: Healing Light (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: The war priest or one creature of its choice within 60 feet of it regains 12 (2d8 + 3) hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes two Rapier attacks, or it uses Bewildering Word twice.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

actions.name: Bewildering Word
actions.desc: The warlock utters a magical bewilderment, targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 9 (2d8) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the warlock's next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

actions.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: In response to taking damage, the warlock turns invisible and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

name: Warlock of the Fiend
languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

traits.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes three Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hellfire
actions.desc: Green flame explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the warlock. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage and 11 (2d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

actions.name: Fiendish Rebuke (3/Day)
actions.desc: In response to being damaged by a visible creature within 60 feet of it, the warlock forces that creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Warlock of the Great Old One

traits.name: Whispering Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes two Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Howling Void
actions.desc: The warlock opens a momentary extraplanar rift within 60 feet of it. The rift is a scream-filled, 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is frightened of the warlock until the start of the warlock's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
traits.desc: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

traits.name: Survivor
traits.desc: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fewer than half its hit points but at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlord makes two Greatsword or Short bow attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Command Ally
legendary.desc: The warlord targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. if the target can see and hear the warlord, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
legendary.desc: The warlord makes one Greatsword or Shortbow attack.

legendary.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: The warlord targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of warlord's next turn.

name: Warrior (lvl 1)
languages: Common, plus one of your choice

traits.name: Martial Role
traits.desc: The warrior has one of the following traits of your choice:

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Protection (Defender Only)
actions.desc: The warrior imposes disadvantage on the attack roll a creature within 5 feet of it whose target isn't the warrior. The warrior must be able to see the attacker.

languages: Common, plus one of your choice

traits.name: Martial Role
traits.desc: The warrior has one of the following traits of your choice:

traits.name: Second Wind
traits.desc: The warrior can use a bonus action on its turn to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + its level. If it does so, it can't use this feature again until it finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Protection (Defender Only)
actions.desc: The warrior imposes disadvantage on the attack roll a creature within 5 feet of it whose target isn't the warrior. The warrior must be able to see the attacker.

name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
languages: Aquan, one language of its creator's choice

name: Were Bat
speed: 30 ft. (climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft. in bat or hybrid form)
immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the abishai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Longsword attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Vicious Reprisal
actions.desc: In response to taking damage, the abishai makes one Bite attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the abishai moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

name: Will-o'-Wisp
conditionImmunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Consume Life
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5-to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

actions.name: Shock
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.desc: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours. Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

actions.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Frigid Rebuke
actions.desc: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 (2d10) cold damage.

traits.name: Plant Camouflage
traits.desc: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.desc: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wood woad makes two Club attacks.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) force damage.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target, the xvart can push the target 5 feet if the target is a Medium or smaller creature.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Low Cunning
actions.desc: The xvart takes the Disengage action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yagnoloth makes one Electrified Touch attack and one Massive Arm attack, or it makes one Massive Arm attack and uses Battlefield Cunning, if available, or Teleport.

actions.name: Electrified Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Massive Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d12 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

actions.name: Battlefield Cunning (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: Up to two allied yugoloths within 60 feet of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.desc: The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within 15 feet of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: The yagnoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The yagnoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

name: Yan-C-Bin
conditionImmunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

name: Yeenoghu
immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

name: Yeth Hound
immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
languages: understands Common, Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak

traits.name: Sunlight Banishment
traits.desc: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

actions.name: Baleful Baying
actions.desc: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

name: Young Crystal Dragon
speed: 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.

name: Young Deep Dragon
speed: 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Living Shadow
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Breath (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales shadowy fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies, and an undead shadow rises from its corpse and acts immediately after the dragon in the initiative count. The shadow is under the dragon's control.

name: Young Sapphire Dragon
speed: 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the broodguard can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The broodguard makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
traits.desc:
The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day: suggestion

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Malison Type
traits.desc:
The yuan-ti has one of the following types:  Type 1: Human body with snake head
  Type 2: Human head and body with snakes for arms
  Type 3: Human head and upper body with a serpentine lower body instead of legs

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can use its bite only once.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.ActionsFor Type 2

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two bite attacks using its snake arms.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.ActionsFor Type 3

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

actions.name: Bite (Snake Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.Humanoid in shape but have a wide variety of noticeable serpentine features, such as a snakelike tail in place of legs, a complete covering of scales, a hood like a cobra, a snake's head, or snakes in place of arms. Malisons, also called halfbloods, serve as warriors and temple assistants.
